member.name: FOLDERFLAGS
member.summary: A set of flags that specify folder view options. The flags are independent of each other and can be used in any combination.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NONE
member.summary: 0x00000000. Windows 7 and later. No special view options.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_AUTOARRANGE
member.summary: 0x00000001. Automatically arrange the elements in the view. This implies LVS_AUTOARRANGE if the list-view control is used to implement the view.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_ABBREVIATEDNAMES
member.summary: 0x00000002. Not supported.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_SNAPTOGRID
member.summary: 0x00000004. Not supported.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_OWNERDATA
member.summary: 0x00000008. Not supported.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_BESTFITWINDOW
member.summary: 0x00000010. Not supported.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_DESKTOP
member.summary: 0x00000020. Make the folder behave like the desktop. This value applies only to the desktop and is not used for typical Shell folders. This flag implies FWF_NOCLIENTEDGE and FWF_NOSCROLL.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_SINGLESEL
member.summary: 0x00000040. Do not allow more than a single item to be selected. This is used in the common dialog boxes.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOSUBFOLDERS
member.summary: 0x00000080. Do not show subfolders.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: 0x00000100. Draw transparently. This is used only for the desktop.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOCLIENTEDGE
member.summary: 0x00000200. Not supported.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOSCROLL
member.summary: 0x00000400. Do not add scroll bars. This is used only for the desktop.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_ALIGNLEFT
member.summary: 0x00000800. The view should be left-aligned. This implies LVS_ALIGNLEFT if the list-view control is used to implement the view.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOICONS
member.summary: 0x00001000. The view should not display icons.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_SHOWSELALWAYS
member.summary: 0x00002000. This flag is deprecated as of Windows XP and has no effect. Always show the selection.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOVISIBLE
member.summary: 0x00004000. Not supported.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_SINGLECLICKACTIVATE
member.summary: 0x00008000. Not supported.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOWEBVIEW
member.summary: 0x00010000. The view should not be shown as a web view.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_HIDEFILENAMES
member.summary: 0x00020000. The view should not display file names.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_CHECKSELECT
member.summary: 0x00040000. Turns on the check mode for the view.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOENUMREFRESH
member.summary: 0x00080000. Windows Vista and later. Do not re-enumerate the view (or drop the current contents of the view) when the view is refreshed.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOGROUPING
member.summary: 0x00100000. Windows Vista and later. Do not allow grouping in the view

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_FULLROWSELECT
member.summary: 0x00200000. Windows Vista and later. When an item is selected, the item and all its sub-items are highlighted.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOFILTERS
member.summary: 0x00400000. Windows Vista and later. Do not display filters in the view.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOCOLUMNHEADER
member.summary: 0x00800000. Windows Vista and later. Do not display a column header in the view in any view mode.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOHEADERINALLVIEWS
member.summary: 0x01000000. Windows Vista and later. Only show the column header in details view mode.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_EXTENDEDTILES
member.summary: 0x02000000. Windows Vista and later. When the view is in "tile view mode" the layout of a single item should be extended to the width of the view.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_TRICHECKSELECT
member.summary: 0x04000000. Windows Vista and later. Not supported.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_AUTOCHECKSELECT
member.summary: 0x08000000. Windows Vista and later. Items can be selected using checkboxes.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOBROWSERVIEWSTATE
member.summary: 0x10000000. Windows Vista and later. The view should not save view state in the browser.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_SUBSETGROUPS
member.summary: 0x20000000. Windows Vista and later. The view should list the number of items displayed in each group. To be used with .

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_USESEARCHFOLDER
member.summary: 0x40000000. Windows Vista and later. Use the search folder for stacking and searching.

member.name: FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_ALLOWRTLREADING
member.summary: (int)0x80000000. Windows Vista and later. Ensure right-to-left reading layout in a right-to-left system. Without this flag, the view displays strings from left-to-right both on systems set to left-to-right and right-to-left reading layout, which ensures that file names display correctly.
